32a9dfb5-737d-4301-99e8-ac75fcfb31f8.plaintext: The systematic monitoring of Bio-geophysical Parameters produces a series of qualified bio-geophysical products on the status and evolution of the land surface. The products are used to monitor vegetation, crops, water cycle, energy budget and terrestrial cryosphere variables.

children.text: The systematic monitoring of Bio-geophysical Parameters produces a series of qualified bio-geophysical products on the status and evolution of the land surface. The products are used to monitor vegetation, crops, water cycle, energy budget and terrestrial cryosphere variables.

5af45aa4-d09b-434e-8952-066d4edbc009.plaintext: Priority Area Monitoring aims to provide tailored and more detailed land cover and land use information on specific areas of interest, often called hot-spots. Hotspots in the context of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service are areas prone to specific environmental challenges.

children.text: Priority Area Monitoring aims to provide tailored and more detailed land cover and land use information on specific areas of interest, often called hot-spots. Hotspots in the context of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service are areas prone to specific environmental challenges.

afc0a00b-c65f-4576-9ad1-796c0c1cb402.plaintext: The products of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service are organised into several components as provided below. Please see a detailed overview of each component.

children.text: The products of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service are organised into several components as provided below. Please see a detailed overview of each component.

7e226914-5962-43a7-9fad-f8a24edabffb.plaintext: Land Cover and Land Use Mapping produces land cover classifications at various level of detail, both within a pan-European and global context. At the pan-European level, these are complemented by detailed layers on land cover characteristics, such as imperviousness, forests, grassland, water and wetness and small woody features. At global level, the land cover mapping follows the FAO's modular-hierarchical Land Cover Classification System.

children.text: Land Cover and Land Use Mapping produces land cover classifications at various level of detail, both within a pan-European and global context. At the pan-European level, these are complemented by detailed layers on land cover characteristics, such as imperviousness, forests, grassland, water and wetness and small woody features. At global level, the land cover mapping follows the FAO's modular-hierarchical Land Cover Classification System.

b7c09dc1-7be5-480a-8f19-9e05679acdf5.plaintext: Satellite Data comprise image mosaics from contributing missions covering the territory of Europe as well as Sentinel-2 image mosaic production at global level.

children.text: Satellite Data comprise image mosaics from contributing missions covering the territory of Europe as well as Sentinel-2 image mosaic production at global level.

c1b215dd-837d-4bfe-82a8-7af09a4881f8.plaintext: Reference and Validation Data covers reference datasets providing homogeneous pan-European coverage of some key geospatial themes, such as hydrography and elevation, and in situ measurements collected at global scale to validate core products of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service.

children.text: Reference and Validation Data covers reference datasets providing homogeneous pan-European coverage of some key geospatial themes, such as hydrography and elevation, and in situ measurements collected at global scale to validate core products of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service.

f958af0d-f8f6-4cc8-a6ca-3c0a02683e55.plaintext: In this section we will inform you about new products and services of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service.

children.text: In this section we will inform you about new products and services of the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service.

items.description: The Global Dynamic Land Cover product provides a primary land cover scheme at three classification levels with class definitions according to the Land Cover Classification System (LCCS) scheme. The product is produced annually, and the actual version of the product (V3.0) is available for the 2015-2019 reference years.

image.filename: Global Dynamic Land Cover - Light blue.png

items.title: Global Dynamic Land Cover

items.description: CORINE Land Cover is a pan-European land cover inventory with 44 classes. Initiated in 1985 (the 1990 reference year) the inventory is available  for the 1990, 2000, 2006, 2012 and 2018 reference years including change layers 1990-2000, 2006-2012 and 2012-2018.
items.title: CORINE Land Cover
Corine Land Cover pilots in Eastern Partnership Countries

items.description: High Resolution Layer Imperviousness at pan-European level captures the spatial distribution of artificially sealed areas including the level of sealing of the soil per area unit. The product has a three years cycle and is available for the 2006, 2009, 2012, 2015 and 2018 reference years including change layers available for 2006-2009, 2009-2012, 2012-2015, 2015-2018, and in addition a change layer available for 2006-2012 and aligned with the CORINE Land Cover periodicity.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Imperviousness

items.description: High Resolution Layer Dominant Leaf Type product at pan-European level provides information on the dominant leaf type: broadleaved or coniferous. The product has a three years update cycle and is available for the 2012, 2015 and 2018 reference year including the change layer showing increase or decrease of leaf type mask between 2015 and 2018.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Dominant Leaf Type

items.description: High Resolution Layer Forest Tree Type at pan-European level provides one type of forest products according to the forest definition of the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO). It has a three years update cycle and is available for the 2012, 2015 and 2018 reference year.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Forest Type

items.description: High Resolution Tree Cover Density at pan-European level provides the level of tree cover density in a range from 0-100%.  The product has a three years update cycle and is available for the 2012, 2015 and 2018 reference years including the change product showing increase or decrease of tree cover mask in 2012 - 2015 and 2015 - 2018.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Tree Cover Density

items.description: High Resolution Layer Grassland is a binary product at pan-European level providing a grassland/non-grassland mask. It has a three years update cycle and is available for the 2015 and 2018 reference years including the change layer.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Grassland

items.description: The combined High Resolution Layer Water and Wetness product at pan-European level shows the occurrence of water and wet surfaces over the period from 2009 to 2018.
items.title: High Resolution Layer Water and  Wetness
High Resolution Layer Small Woody Features

items.description: The CLMS Coastal Zones product provides users with high resolution satellite imagery necessary for making informed decisions about coastal ecosystem management (e.g. identifying areas that require conservation), land-use planning (e.g. in areas with competing resource demands), and disaster management (e.g. forecasting the impact of storms and flooding). The product covers the entirety of European coastal areas to an inland depth of 10 kilometres with a total area of roughly 730,000 square kilometres. It is on a six year update cycle, and currently consists of three layers: an LC/LU status layer for both 2012 and 2018, as well as a LC/LU change layer for the period between 2012 and 2018.
items.title: Coastal Zones

items.description: N2K product provides detailed land cover and land use information in a large number (4.790) of grassland rich Natura 2000 sites including a 2 km buffer zone. The product has a six years update cycle and is available for the 2006, 2012 and 2018 reference years including the change layers.
items.title: N2K

items.description: Riparian Zones product provides detailed information on the state and characteristics of riparian zones across Europe in a variable buffer zone of selected rivers (Strahler levels 2-9 derived from EU-Hydro). The product has a six years update cycle and is available for the 2012 and 2018 reference years including the change layer.
items.title: Riparian Zones

items.description: Urban Atlas provides pan-European comparable land cover and land use information for the selected Functional Urban Areas (FUA) in Europe and the United Kingdom. The product has a six years update cycle and is available for the 2006, 2012 and 2018 reference years including the change layers. For the 2012 and 2018 reference years a derived from FUAs separate street tree layer is available, and for the 2012 reference year the product suite is complemented with building height information.
items.title: Urban Atlas

items.description: The Copernicus Hot Spot Monitoring (HSM) activity delivers land cover and land cover change products on Key Landscapes for Conservation (KLC) and protected areas, with an initial emphasis on the African continent, which are characterized by pronounced anthropogenic pressures that require high mapping accuracy.
items.title: Land Cover and Land Cover Change in selected hot-spots outside Europe

items.description: At pan-European level the Snow and Ice parameters provide high resolution data about snow properties on land and ice occurrences in the hydrographic network. Mostly disseminated in near real time these high resolution Snow and Ice parameters are available since September 2016. Across the Northern Hemisphere Snow and Ice parameters are provided in near-real-time at lower level of details.  Here the Snow Water Equivalent is available since January 2006, and the Lake Ice Extent and the Snow Cover Extent are available since March 2017.
items.title: Snow and Ice Parameters
Low Resolution Snow and Ice Parameters

items.description: High-Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity parameters at pan-European level provides three product groups: daily vegetation indices, 10-daily seasonal trajectories and annual vegetation phenology and productivity parameters. The complete product suite is operational since January 2017 onwards.
items.title: High Resolution Vegetation Phenology and Productivity Parameters

items.description: EU-DEM is a digital surface model (DSM) at pan-European level representing the first surface as illuminated by the sensors. It is a hybrid product based on SRTM and ASTER GDEM data fused by a weighted averaging approach.
items.title: EU-DEM

items.description: EU-Hydro at pan-European level provides a photo-interpreted river network, consistent of surface interpretation of water bodies (lakes and wide rivers), and a drainage model (also called Drainage Network), derived from EU-DEM, with catchments and drainage lines and nodes.
items.title: EU-Hydro
